message.content:
cs.SI, cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SD, cs.CY 

Reasoning: The paper discusses the self-organization of scientific communication in Mode-2 fields of knowledge production, which involves interdisciplinary collaboration and the use of digital technologies. This suggests that the paper could belong to the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI). Additionally, the paper uses entropy measures to analyze the distribution of cited references and title-words, which could fall under the sub-category of Digital Libraries (cs.DL) or Information Retrieval (cs.IR). The paper also discusses the institutional and cognitive levels of scientific communication, which could relate to the sub-category of Software Development (cs.SD) or Cybersecurity (cs.CY).
